text: The Hunchback of Notre Dame (, "Our Lady of Paris") is a 1831 French historical novel written by Victor Hugo. It is set in 1482 Paris. The story is about a Gypsy (Esmeralda), a bell-ringer in the cathedral of Notre Dame de Paris (Quasimodo) and the archdeacon (Claude Frollo). ==Other websites== * The Hunchback of Notre Dame at Internet Archive and Google Books, multiple English translations (scanned books original editions color illustrated) * , 1888 English translation by Isabel Florence Hapgood (plain text and HTML) * The Hunchback of Notre Dame at LibriVox, 1888 English translation by Isabel Florence Hapgood (audiobook) * Notre Dame de Paris Harvard Classics * Notre- Dame de Paris at Wikisource (HTML) Category:1830s books Category:French novels Category:Works by Victor Hugo
title: The Hunchback of Notre Dame
